googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Oklahoma driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox6: Enter the last 4 digits of your Social Security Number.  If you don't have one, enter your OK driver's license number instead.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules: Any registered Oklahoma voter may request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfSubmissionAddress:
Oklahoma State Election Board  
Box 528800  
Oklahoma City, OK 73152‐8800
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: Oklahoma voters must show ID that meets four requirements.  One, it must show your name.  Two, it must show your photograph.  Three, it must not be expired.  Four, it must be issued by the state of Oklahoma, the federal government, or a federally recognized Indian tribe or nation.  You could also just show your Oklahoma voter registration card (issued by your county board of elections).
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: Your local election office will compare your signature on your voted ballot to the one on your driver’s license. If the signatures don't match, your ballot might be rejected. Please sign carefully.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.year2020LegalChanges: The Oklahoma Supreme Court has ruled that absentee ballots do not need to be notarized to be counted for the June 30, 2020 Primary and Special Elections.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox7: Oklahoma has closed primaries. You must register with a party if you want to take part in that party’s primary election, caucus, or convention.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm: Oklahoma voters will need to have their ** voted ballots** notarized or signed by two witnesses.  If the affidavit envelope has a yellow stripe, the ballot must be notarized.  If it the envelope has a pink stripe, the ballot must be signed by two witnesses.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Oklahoma you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States and a resident of the State of Oklahoma
  * be 18 years old on or before the date of the next election
  * have not been convicted of a felony, for which a period of time equal to the original sentence has not expired, or for which you have not been pardoned
  * not now be under judgment as an incapacitated person, or a partially incapacitated person prohibited from registering to vote
